awd_titl_txt: CNS: CORE: Small: Collaborative Research: Towards Sustainable, Efficient and Secure IoT
awd_abstract_narration:
To meet the ever-growing need of energy supply for the Internet of Things (IoT) devices, energy harvesting is emerging as a promising alternative to traditional power grids and batteries. The goal of this project is to develop energy-efficient and secure wireless communication systems and protocols for renewable energy-powered IoT devices. In particular, this project will develop novel techniques for network synchronization, efficient data transmission, and security and will tackle the challenges arising from practical issues such as limited power supply and other unique features of renewable energy-powered systems. The project will provide a rich environment and platform that will facilitate educating and training students from high school level to graduate level. 

The goal of this project is to develop energy-efficient and secure wireless communication systems and protocols for renewable energy-powered IoT devices.  This project is organized around three research thrusts. As part of the first thrust, the PIs will develop a wake-up radio-based time synchronization method, which can achieve high synchronization precision and ultra-low energy cost. In the second thrust, the PI will develop a new nonlinear recursive energy harvesting model that considers practical aspects of  wireless systems. In the third thrust, the PIs will analyze new security threats caused by malicious energy attacks and will develop novel reinforcement learning-based intelligent attack and defense mechanisms. This project will develop a multi-disciplinary approach that brings together multiple fields in networking, energy harvesting, and security. The project will provide a rich environment and platform that will facilitate educating and training students from high school level to graduate level. 

This project is jointly funded by the Computer and Networking System Program and  the Established Program to Stimulate Competitive Research (EPSCoR).

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
Over the course of this project, our team has made significant strides in enhancing the sustainability, efficiency, and security of Internet of Things (IoT) networks powered by renewable energy. Recognizing the growing demand for energy-efficient and secure communication in various applications, we focused on developing innovative solutions that could operate effectively with minimal energy consumption.

Intellectual Merit 

One of our key achievements is the development of an energy-preserving Wake-up Radio (WuR) based time synchronization method. Traditional wireless networks often consume a lot of energy just to keep devices synchronized. Our WuR-based approach significantly reduces this energy usage, making it feasible to deploy renewable energy-powered wireless networks across a wide range of IoT applications—such as environmental monitoring, smart agriculture, and infrastructure health monitoring.

We also conducted an in-depth investigation of real-world system features to develop practical and efficient data transmission strategies. By optimizing how data is sent and received in energy-harvesting wireless networks, we have been able to boost their throughput capacity. This means these networks can handle more data without requiring additional energy, making them more effective for applications that need to transmit large amounts of information.

Furthermore, we explored emerging vulnerabilities in energy-harvesting wireless networks that have been underrepresented in existing research. By identifying and understanding these weaknesses, we have contributed valuable knowledge to the research community, paving the way for the development of more secure and resilient IoT networks.

To support ongoing and future research, we developed an energy-harvesting IoT testbed. This experimental setup allows us and other researchers to conduct field experiments in a controlled environment. The data collected from these experiments will be made publicly available, encouraging collaboration and further advancements in the field.

Broader Impacts

Our project has several broader impacts on research, education, and society. From a research standpoint, we aim to inspire other scientists and engineers to delve into the study of sustainable, efficient, and secure IoT networks. By widely disseminating our results—including through social media and academic publications—we hope to advance the applications of energy-harvesting wireless networks across various sectors.

In the realm of education, we have integrated our research findings into existing university courses, enriching the curriculum with the latest developments in IoT technology. We have also developed new courses focused on green communications and networking and emerging security issues in IoT. These educational initiatives provide a rich learning environment for students at all levels, from high school to graduate studies, preparing the next generation of engineers and researchers.

On a societal level, our project addresses critical issues related to sustainability and security in the rapidly expanding world of IoT. By promoting sustainable practices and enhancing the security of IoT devices, we contribute to the development of smarter, more efficient cities and communities. Our work has the potential to impact various industries, including agriculture, infrastructure management, and environmental conservation, by providing the tools necessary for long-term, scalable, and automated sensing solutions.

Conclusion

In summary, this project has made significant contributions to advancing the field of sustainable IoT networks. Through our innovative approaches to energy efficiency, data transmission, and security, we have laid the groundwork for future research and practical applications that will benefit both the scientific community and society at large. Our efforts not only push the boundaries of current technology but also foster an environment where education and societal advancement go hand in hand.
